metadata.Title: CVE-2020-15673 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Mozilla developers reported memory safety bugs present in Firefox 80 and Firefox ESR 78.2. Some of these bugs showed evidence of memory corruption and we presume that with enough effort some of these could have been exploited to run arbitrary code. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 81, Thunderbird < 78.3, and Firefox ESR < 78.3.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-15673` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 81.0+build2-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
firefox-geckodriver - 81.0+build2-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
firefox-mozsymbols - 81.0+build2-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

notes.Note: tyhicks> mozjs contains a copy of the SpiderMonkey JavaScript engine

criterions.comment: firefox package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '81.0+build2-0ubuntu0.16.04.1').
thunderbird: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
